alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McIntosh and south central Muskogee Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 511 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Checotah, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Checotah... Warner... Porum... Rentiesville... Lake Eufaula State Park... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 258 and 280. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
